Topic.Title: The inclusion of other Text RPGs?

Posts.EditableText: What about developers who have taken the time to code their own system to make a text RPG interactive story that goes beyond simply click and go? For instance I created this: RulerOfKings.com which allows you to not only read the story but create your own while building a detailed character. There are no options for me to share it based on your current system.
Posts.HTML: What about developers who have taken the time to code their own system to make a text RPG interactive story that goes beyond simply click and go? For instance I created this: RulerOfKings.com which allows you to not only read the story but create your own while building a detailed character. There are no options for me to share it based on your current system.

Posts.EditableText:
If it's made in HTML5, you can upload it to textadventures.co.uk regardless of what it was made in. I have a Twine game, a Texture game, and two custom games here, one of which is composed of several files. All of them worked just fine on the first try.

_Ruler of Kings_ however, if I understand correctly, is a multiplayer game, which means it has a server component... which means it's not stand-alone and you can't just upload it wherever. Itch.io or Game Jolt wouldn't be able to accept it either, for instance. I dare say it's not exactly reasonable to expect that from a general-purpose game portal/marketplace.

But you can always tell people about the game and invite them over to play. Others have done so successfully on this forum. Check your referrals!
Posts.HTML:
If it's made in HTML5, you can upload it to textadventures.co.uk regardless of what it was made in. I have a Twine game, a Texture game, and two custom games here, one of which is composed of several files. All of them worked just fine on the first try.

Ruler of Kings however, if I understand correctly, is a multiplayer game, which means it has a server component... which means it's not stand-alone and you can't just upload it wherever. Itch.io or Game Jolt wouldn't be able to accept it either, for instance. I dare say it's not exactly reasonable to expect that from a general-purpose game portal/marketplace.

But you can always tell people about the game and invite them over to play. Others have done so successfully on this forum. Check your referrals!

Posts.EditableText: There was one other person who made a MMO life simulator text adventure. I don't know the story behind it though, so I can't tell you if that will help. Search for it, young one.... ...I'm being dramatic....

@jmnevil54

>Well, that does give me an idea. Make a new game here, then link whatever game you have to that.

You can have an online Quest game inside of an iframe in a Quest game, but you'd have to widen the game Content display.  (NOTE: I've loaded a game this way, but I never widened it and played it.)

Posts.EditableText:
I rather not create a game here just to link to another. I try to create stuff considering how the end user will feel about it and if I were the reader I think I will be put off by it, but thanks anyway.

Please send me mail to my inbox if you know other places (sites) I could probably share my creation. 

PS. This site does not send out notification of replies?
